H0.text: The reason gravity works is because masses bend time and space is a statement about gravity that is written as a law.

H1.text: The effect of gravity on plants might be reduced if certain minerals are added to the soil is written as a law about gravity.

H2.text: The force of gravity between two objects depends upon their masses and the distance between them is the statement about gravity that is written as a law.

H3.text: The statement that the experiments being done on gravity today are better than what were done in the past and a full understanding is only a few years away is not a law about gravity.

A4.text: Newton's law of universal gravitation describes gravity as a force by stating that every particle attracts every other particle in the universe with a force that is proportional to the product of their masses and inversely proportional to the square of the distance between their centers of mass.
